bug.author: networks1
bug.description:
Hi. Trying to run the example code from <denchmark-link:https://spacy.io/universe/project/neuralcoref/>spaCy universe</denchmark-link> . Getting the following runtime warnings when importing: <denchmark-code>>>> import neuralcoref
<frozen importlib._bootstrap>:219: RuntimeWarning: spacy.morphology.Morphology size changed, may indicate binary incompatibility. Expected 104 from C header, got 112 from PyObject
<frozen importlib._bootstrap>:219: RuntimeWarning: spacy.vocab.Vocab size changed, may indicate binary incompatibility. Expected 96 from C header, got 112 from PyObject
<frozen importlib._bootstrap>:219: RuntimeWarning: spacy.tokens.span.Span size changed, may indicate binary incompatibility. Expected 72 from C header, got 80 from PyObject </denchmark-code>
This is a fresh install of spaCy and neuralcoref (python3 on WSL, in case that matters). Not sure if it's related to the above, but also got a segmentation fault after <denchmark-code>nlp = spacy.load('en')
neuralcoref.add_to_pipe(nlp)
doc1 = nlp('My sister has a dog. She loves him.') </denchmark-code>

comments.comment: Hi! Please see Issue <denchmark-link:https://github.com/huggingface/neuralcoref/issues/197>#197</denchmark-link> for installation instructions with a recent spaCy version!
